author: mmathews@times-news.com(Mike Mathews)
title: Allegany routs Berkeley Springs
text:
Allegany routs Berkeley Springs from staff reports The Cumberland Times-News Posted on Oct 9, 2015 by Mike Mathews 
BERKELEY SPRINGS, W.Va. — Jakson Bauer completed three of four passes for 100 yards and a pair of touchdowns, both to Hunter Moorehead, and the Allegany defense held Berkeley Springs to negative yardage for the game in a 53-0 victory in freshman football Wednesday night. 
Moorehead caught two passes, both for TDs, for 83 yards, while Josh Shirey had seven carries and 88 yards and Amedeaus Swinton three carries and 53 yards for Allegany (4-1). 
Shirey scored the first of four first-quarter touchdowns on an 11-yard run, and Moorehead hooked up with Bauer on a 51-yard pass play to make it 15-0. Swinton had a 44-yard interception return and a 34-yard run for touchdowns to boost the Campers lead to 28-0 after one quarter. 
Bauer and Moorehead hooked up again on a 32-yard touchdown, and Bauer had a five-yard touchdown run to extend the lead to 41-0 at the half. Shirey scored on a 56-yard punt return and Jacob Dent on a 25-yard run in the second half. 
Allegany’s defense had seven sacks and held Berkeley Springs to minus-13 yards of offense. 
The Campers will play again Wednesday at Bedford at 6 p.m. 
Altoona 14Fort Hill 12 
CUMBERLAND — Altoona scored a pair of touchdowns in the fourth quarter to rally for a two-point victory over Fort Hill Wednesday night at Greenway Avenue Stadium. 
Jayden Haines scored both Fort Hill touchdowns, with a nine-yard run in the first quarter and a 35-yard run in the third. 
Haines finished with 63 yards rushing and Nick Lamb ran for 58 yards. Shakur Trimble led the defense with six tackles, while Hayden Watson and Braden Askins had five. Anthony Smith had an interception. 
The Sentinels will play at South Hagerstown on Wednesday at 5 p.m. The junior varsity game will follow at 7 o’clock. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
